sen.j: 中牟田 倉之助（なかむた くらのすけ、天保8年2月24日 (旧暦)(1837年3月30日)－大正5年(1916年)3月30日）は、日本の大日本帝国海軍軍人。
sen.e: Kuranosuke NAKAMUTA was a military man in the Imperial Japanese Navy who lived from March 30, 1837 to March 30, 1916.
Kuranosuke NAKAMUTA was a military man in the Imperial Japanese Navy who lived from March 30, 1837 to March 30, 1916.
Kuranosuke NAKAMUTA was a military man in the Imperial Japanese Navy who lived from March 30, 1837 to March 30, 1916.

sen.j: 海軍大学校長、枢密院 (日本)、子爵。
sen.e: He was president of Naval War College, privy councilor and viscount.
sen.cmt: ※「枢密院」は「枢密院顧問官」と解釈しています。
sen.e: He was president of Naval War College, privy councilor and viscount.
He was president of Naval War College, privy councilor and viscount.
His childhood name was Takeomi.
His childhood name was Takeomi.
His childhood name was Takeomi.

sen.j: もとは金丸孫七郎の次男だったが、中牟田家の養子となる。
sen.e: Once the second son of Magoshichiro KANEMARU, he was adopted by the Nakamuta family.
He was born as the second son of Magoshichiro KANEMARU, but he was adopted by the Nakamuta family.
sen.cmt: 文頭をHe was born asと変更し、コンマの後にbutを挿入しました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Magoshichiro KANEMARU, but he was adopted by the Nakamuta family.
Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 藩主・鍋島直正の推薦で安政3年(1856年)、20歳で長崎海軍伝習所へ入所し、卒業後には佐賀藩海軍方助役を務めて海軍力の発展を促す。
sen.e: At the recommendation of Naomasa NABESHIMA, the lord of the Saga domain, NAKAMUTA entered a naval school in Nagasaki at 20 in 1856, and after graduation, he served as assistant of mayor in the domain's Navy and contributed to its development.

At the recommendation of Naomasa NABESHIMA, the lord of domain, NAKAMUTA entered a naval school in Nagasaki at the age of 20 in 1856, and after graduation, he served as an assistant of mayor in the domain's Navy and contributed to its development.
sen.cmt: 藩主とあり、佐賀藩主とは原文にないため、the Sagaは削除しました。年齢の表現をat the age of 20に訂正しました。Assistantに、冠詞anを挿入しました。
sen.e: At the recommendation of Naomasa NABESHIMA, the lord of domain, NAKAMUTA entered a naval school in Nagasaki at the age of 20 in 1856, and after graduation, he served as an assistant of mayor in the domain's Navy and contributed to its development.

sen.j: 慶応4年(1868年)に戊辰戦争が勃発すると奥州方面へ出陣し、北越戦争に参戦して旧幕府軍を追討。
sen.e: When the Boshin War broke out in 1868, he went to the Oshu resions, and participated in the Hokuetsu War to defeat the army of the former bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
When the Boshin War broke out in 1868, he went to the Oshu region, and participated in the Hokuetsu War to defeat the army of the former bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: Oshu regionと誤字を訂正しました。
sen.e: When the Boshin War broke out in 1868, he went to the Oshu region, and participated in the Hokuetsu War to defeat the army of the former bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 明治2年(1869年)3月に新政府軍艦「朝陽丸」の艦長に任命されると、4月には品川沖を出航して蝦夷地での箱館戦争に参戦した。
sen.e: He was appointed in March, 1869 as captain of 'Choyo-maru,' a warship of the new government, and in April he left the Shinagawa port and took part in the Battle of Hakodate in Ezochi (inhabited area of Ainu).

In March, 1869, he was appointed as captain of 'Choyo-maru', a warship of the new government, and he left the Shinagawa port in April and took part in the Battle of Hakodate in Ezochi (inhabited area of Ainu).
sen.cmt: 文頭と文中の日付の部分の語順を変更しました。Choyo-maruのあとのコンマを ' ' の外に出しました。
sen.e: In March, 1869, he was appointed as captain of 'Choyo-maru', a warship of the new government, and he left the Shinagawa port in April and took part in the Battle of Hakodate in Ezochi (inhabited area of Ainu).

sen.j: しかし箱館総攻撃の5月11日、旧幕府軍艦「蟠龍丸」の砲弾が朝陽丸の火薬庫に直撃し大爆発を起こす。
sen.e: But in May 11, the shells fired by 'Banryu-maru,' a warship of the former bakufu, directly hit the ammunition storage on Choyo-maru, triggering a huge explosion.

However on May 11, on the day of the all-out attack in Hakodate, the shells fired by a warship of the former bakufu 'Banryu-maru' directly hit the ammunition storage on Choyo-maru and triggered a huge explosion.
sen.cmt: 文頭をHoweverで始め、函館総攻撃の用語を挿入し、旧幕府軍艦の説明箇所の語順を変更したうえ、全体を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: However on May 11, on the day of the all-out attack in Hakodate, the shells fired by a warship of the former bakufu 'Banryu-maru' directly hit the ammunition storage on Choyo-maru and triggered a huge explosion.

sen.j: 中牟田は奇跡的にも英国船「パール号」に救助されて一命を取り留めたが重傷で、副艦長夏秋又之助以下50人余りの乗組員を失った。
sen.e: NAKAMUTA was miraculously saved by the British ship 'Pearl' but was seriously injured, as he lost vice commander Matanosuke NATSUAKI and fifty other crew members.
NAKAMUTA was miraculously saved by the British ship 'Pearl' and survived, but seriously injured, and he lost vice commander Matanosuke NATSUAKI and fifty other crew members.
sen.cmt: 一命を取り留めた、の意味でsurvivedを挿入しました。後半はasではなく、andでつなげました。
sen.e: NAKAMUTA was miraculously saved by the British ship 'Pearl' and survived, but seriously injured, and he lost vice commander Matanosuke NATSUAKI and fifty other crew members.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争時の勲功により明治3年(1870年)に海軍中佐、明治5年(1872年)には大佐に昇進し、明治10年(1877年)の西南戦争でも勲功があったため海軍中将に昇進。
sen.e: With his deed of valor in the Boshin war, he was promoted to lieutenant colonel of the Navy in 1870 and to colonel in 1972; and his further achievements in the Seinan War in 1877 promoted him to vice admiral of the Navy.

With his deed of valor in the Boshin war, he was promoted to lieutenant colonel of the Navy in 1870 and to colonel in 1872; and his further achievements in the Seinan War in 1877 promoted him to vice admiral of the Navy.
sen.cmt: 年号の表記ミスを1872に訂正しました。
sen.e: With his deed of valor in the Boshin war, he was promoted to lieutenant colonel of the Navy in 1870 and to colonel in 1872; and his further achievements in the Seinan War in 1877 promoted him to vice admiral of the Navy.

sen.j: 後、海軍大学校長や枢密顧問官も務める。
sen.e: Subsequently, he served as president of the Naval War College as well as privy councilor.
Subsequently, he served as president of the Naval War College as well as privy councilor.
Subsequently, he served as president of the Naval War College as well as privy councilor.

sen.j: 日清戦争直前海軍軍令部長を勤めていたが、清の北洋艦隊の戦力を高く評価し、徹底した非戦派であった。
sen.e: While he was department director of the military order in the Navy just before the Sino-Japanese War, he was strictly on the noncombatant side because he appreciated the military potential of China's North Sea Fleet.

While he was department director of the military order in the Navy just before the Sino-Japanese War, he was strictly on the noncombatant side because he appreciated the military potential of China's North Sea Fleet.

While he was department director of the military order in the Navy just before the Sino-Japanese War, he was strictly on the noncombatant side because he appreciated the military potential of China's North Sea Fleet.

sen.j: そのため、開戦派であった山本権兵衛に軍令部長を解任させられ、樺山資紀と交代させられてしまうこともあった。
sen.e: Therefore, he was dismissed as department director of the military order by Gonbei YAMAMOTO, who was on the combatant side, and was replaced by Sukenori KABAYAMA.
Therefore, he was removed from his position of the department director of the military order by Gonbei YAMAMOTO, who was on the combatant side, and was replaced by Sukenori KABAYAMA.
sen.cmt: 解任されるという一文をremoveを使い訂正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, he was removed from his position of the department director of the military order by Gonbei YAMAMOTO, who was on the combatant side, and was replaced by Sukenori KABAYAMA.
He died in 1916.
He died in 1916.
He died in 1916.
He was 80.
He was 80 years old.
sen.cmt: years old を追加しました。
sen.e: He was 80 years old.
